definition: one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit

home/family/(polite) my (sister, uncle etc)/classifier for families or businesses/refers to the philosophical schools of pre-Han China/noun suffix for a specialist in some activity, such as a musician or revolutionary, corresponding to English -ist, -er, -ary or -ian/CL:個|个[ge4]
owner/master/host/individual or party concerned/God/Lord/main/to indicate or signify/trump card (in card games)

sentences.english: Several years later, his son completed his education. He returned home to take his place as the head of the family.
sentences.chinese: 幾年之後，他的兒子學成歸來，成爲了一家之主。

sentences.english: A house in filial piety is Lord of as vice President, in elementary school.
sentences.chinese: 在孝是安家的一家之主，在小學擔任副校長。

sentences.english: He bethought himself of his responsibility as head of the house.
sentences.chinese: 他不忘自己身爲一家之主的責任。

sentences.english: He was the man of the family, the decision maker, the leader.
sentences.chinese: 他是家裏的男子漢，決策者，一家之主。

sentences.english: Successful family manager? Practice and cultivate it.
sentences.chinese: 成功的一家之主？練習並培養吧。

sentences.english: At the top of it is the head of the household, the man, the paterfamilias.
sentences.chinese: 金字塔頂端是一家之主，男人，即家長。

sentences.english: Fathers worried that they were abrogating their responsibilities as breadwinner.
sentences.chinese: 父親們則擔憂他們正在卸下一家之主的責任。

sentences.english: being a leader for your family.
sentences.chinese: 作爲一家之主的自豪感。

definition: to be in charge in one's own house (idiom)/to be the master of one's own affairs
the old and the young/the youngest member of the family
erhua variant of 兒媳婦|儿媳妇[er2 xi2 fu5]
(said of sb else's wife) a good wife
to take care of one's family
